rules: Rule1: Either the organization has approved the exhibition, or the curator is authorized for artwork1, or artwork1 has public access.
Rule2: Provided that artwork1 is authenticated, it is displayed in the gallery.
Rule3: Whenever artwork1 is loaned to the museum, the organization has not approved the exhibition.
Rule4: Artwork1 is insured, or it is authenticated, or it is loaned to the museum.
Rule5: If artwork1 is sold, then it is owned by the collector.
Rule6: In the event that artwork1 is sold, it is not owned by the collector.
Rule7: Artwork1 is sold, or it is not the case that artwork1 is restored.
Rule8: If it is not the case that artwork1 is displayed in the gallery or the organization has not approved the exhibition, then artwork1 is stored in the warehouse.
Rule9: Should it be false that artwork1 is displayed in the gallery or the organization has not approved the exhibition, then artwork1 is restored.
Rule10: Assuming it is not true that artwork1 is displayed in the gallery or the organization has not approved the exhibition, then artwork1 is not stored in the warehouse.
facts: Fact1: It is not the case that the curator is authorized for artwork1.
Fact2: It is not the case that artwork1 is displayed in the gallery.
Fact3: It is not the case that artwork1 is insured.
